hemibrainr 0.1.0
  • Reference

Read precomputed information from the hemibrain Google Drive

Source: R/hemibrain_googledrive.R
hemibrain_googledrive.Rd

Read precomputed data available on the hemibrain Google Team Drive. This includes all synapses, neuron-neuron connections and an edgelist for all hemibrain neurons, broken down by axon and dendrite assignments. NBLAST matrices for all neurons against all neurons in the data set are also available, including ones broken down by neuron compartment.

hemibrain_neuron_bodyids(savedir = TRUE, local = FALSE)

hemibrain_elist(
  savedir = TRUE,
  local = FALSE,
  neuron.split = c("polypre_centrifugal_synapses", "polypre_centrifugal_distance")
)

hemibrain_synapses(
  savedir = TRUE,
  local = FALSE,
  neuron.split = c("polypre_centrifugal_synapses", "polypre_centrifugal_distance")
)

hemibrain_connections(
  savedir = TRUE,
  local = FALSE,
  neuron.split = c("polypre_centrifugal_synapses", "polypre_centrifugal_distance")
)

hemibrain_nblast(
  nblast = c("all", "primary.neurites", "primary.dendrites", "axons", "dendrites",
    "spines", "tracts", "arbour", "simplified"),
  savedir = TRUE,
  local = FALSE,
  neuron.split = c("polypre_centrifugal_synapses", "polypre_centrifugal_distance")
)

flycircuit_neurons(
  savedir = TRUE,
  local = FALSE,
  folder = "hemibrain_neurons/light_level/flycircuit",
  cable = c("all", "primary.neurites", "arbour"),
  data = c("neuronlist", "nblast", "dps")
)

Arguments

savedir

directory in which neuron data has been deposited. If TRUE your default save directory is used, which is stored as: getOption("Gdrive_hemibrain_data")
local

logical, whether to try to read locally saved neurons (by default at: getOption("hemibrain_data")) or neurons from Google Drive (getOption("Gdrive_hemibrain_data")).
neuron.split

read saved neurons split in which way? Folder names indicative of arguments passed to flow_centrality. and hemibrain_flow_centrality
nblast

the NBLAST matrix you would like to retrieve, e.g. "arbours" gives you a normalised all by all NBLAST matrix of all branching arbour.
folder

A subfolder containing the data object to read.
cable

the type of cable we want to read. "all" indicates full neurons.
data

the type of data to read, i.e. neurons, an NBLAST matrix or a dotprops object.

Value

a data.frame or character vector

See also

hemibrain_splitpoints, hemibrain_flow_centrality, hemibrain_precomputed_splitpoints, hemibrain_metrics

Examples

# \donttest{
if (FALSE) {

#  All neuprint IDs for neurons that have a split precomputed
ids = hemibrain_neuron_bodyids()

# Connectivity edgelist, broken down by axon/dendrite
elist = hemibrain_edgelist()

}# }
